entries.meaning: (golf, dated) A metal-headed golf club with little loft, equivalent in a modern set of clubs to a one or two iron or a four wood.
examples: He had begun at four, playing with a miniature cleek and a found shilling ball over the municipal links.

verbs.description: cleek (third-person singular simple present cleeks, present participle cleeking, simple past and past participle cleeked)

entries.meaning: (golf, dated, transitive) To strike with the club called a cleek.
examples: [â€¦]  ready to acclaim his exploits, and listen to volumes about every hole, and the marvellous way in which he cleeked his tee off the bogie.
